text: For those pageants, a group of very smart, but very mean, old men and women deconstruct the participants minds to decide which ones to destroy, and which ones to champion, with their questions. When you are no longer pretty to them, if they hate you to death, they will figure out how to break your heart, over and over again, until you can no longer even recognize your former self, a beautiful girl. Then, they will blame you for the tragedy they inflicted upon you and lock you away from everything that is good, to hide their crimes.
author: Viper

text: I think every once in a while when I remember this song exists I sit in front of the mirror and just stare deeply into myself whilst listening to the lyrics wondering where my insecurities rooted from. Sitting here writing this as a cry because I dont even know what I genuinely look like.  Growing up I got called a pretty girl but now as a teenager my eyes opened and being able to see how judgmental and superficial our world has become. The older I got, the more self conscious I am about the unnoticeable things. Constantly being worried on how the world perceives me. Being a woman comes with so many factors of never feeling pretty enough.

text: I loved this song since it came out when I was in HS, but now at 26 it hits a lot deeper. I came to terms that I have been dealing with an eating disorder since I was 12 (I was always called "fat" by my peers even though I was 5 ft 4 and 120 pounds). I quickly dropped to 110 and my family was always worried. I guess I hid behind the guise of being "healthy" when really, I wasn't. My entire hand HAS to fit around my wrist, I HAVE to have a thigh gap, I HAVE to feel and see my ribs, and I NEED to see my collarbone. Now, I'm eating whenever I'm hungry and try not to critique certain parts of my body. I still go for walks and eat healthy for longevity, not for appearances. It's freeing honestly.
author: Cassandra

text: This brings tears to my eyes. I never realized that my looks were the cause of a lot of problems in my life. Now I’m 45 single and don’t trust a soul. It’s sad. Men lie just to sleep with me or be in my presence. They don’t get to know me and they don’t see past the surface. Women can’t stand me. I tried to downplay my looks for years. I’ve learned to embrace my looks now but it’s a lonely road. I’m smart, fun, loving abs kind but yet still single because people judge me off how I look which is no fault of my own. It can be sad and overwhelming 😢😢😢😢😢

text: When I was going through a manic phase, my mania emphisized every word I heard with extra emotion. I knew one day I had to seek treatment when this video played. I was glued to the monitor and was just balling my eyes out uncontrollably sad for the situation. It was strange because when I'm not manic I'm even keeled and often distant, but for some reason this song caught me in a mood where I put extra meaning into everything I heard like the words were speaking a story directly too me. It caught me at my weakest moment and although I still love the song, I pray to God I never get that caught up in sorrow again.
author: Jason Kelly

text:
We’re told we’re to thik …as we shed away the weight, smiling as we watch the numbers on the scale drop as we bend over the toilet an watch the weight drip away....we stand there looking in the mirror and at them, though underneath that smile they see. We are drowning in pain...full of numb emotion... but sadly they are not satisfied😔😶your to thin they say...they say, you should eat some cake that  might help to put some meat on your bones or they say to you...eat a burger…we smile as tears fall down our face as we force every bite down...feeling like every bite feels like globs of poison sliding down our throat.. rivers of tears fall from our eyes as we stand there in the mirror tracing are fingers across are ribs. Or standing there imagining taking scissors slicing all that chub from are face, are stomach calling are self horrible names.
This world is unkind.😔

text: She struggles to find her aspiration in life because her life is so busy and she is simply just trying to make it through the day and can't focus or rest. When she says that she aspires to be happy, she continues to think of how she puts burdens and struggles on herself and the happiness is not real. This happens to so many people and we don't always realize when it's happening. We get so caught up in the busy way of the world that we just try to get through and don't know what else there is to be happy about. It can be hard to find happiness in this world or purpose in this world. There are always more people to please and there is always more work to be done. We need to try to stop looking at situations with our mind and start searching with our heart. We need purpose in life and it can be very hard to find. I don't have an answer for how to find purpose and stop living every moment like your an actor or pageant girl on a stage. It's different for all of us. I'm currently struggling with that. I am starting to feel like every day is the same like just another stage. I try so hard to express myself and I struggle. I'm just gonna keep trying and reaching out because I don't know what else to do. This song can apply to so many situations. To me, this song is so beautiful and it really helps me think clearly and express myself.

text:
It shines the light that eating disorders are real! Society puts unrealistic ideals on women what it means for a woman to be beautiful.  It's a lie. It's fake! Don't fall for it! I'm also sick of it! I want my own clinic for girls for eating disorders so they can have hope & get better & love themselves. 
Be who you are! Healthy,  happy, whole,  who God created you to be. Thanks Beyonce for this song & video!
Also i want to be open and honest,  I suffered from a eating disorder,  it reminds me of I went through.  I was always looking at the scale,  letting magazines determine if I was pretty or not, etc, I was miserable.( There's more though to what happen to me & how i ended up with anorexia nervousa)  I'm not doing that though  anymore...By the grace of God,  I'm better now! Very better!!
Thanks Beyonce!

text: Antigamente eu endeusava esse clipe e admirava Beyonce por ter feito. Mas hoje vejo que na prática ela faz o contrário, não vivencia o que diz. No próprio clipe a Be aparece mega produzida, magra de silhueta ampulheta, cabelo alisado, vestindo o que se entende por glamour. Ela faz o personagem da letra mas também é assim nos outros clipes. Beyoncé é uma artista que quer encorajar outras pessoas a quebrar padrões estéticos mas ela não abre mão dos procedimentos pra se adequar nesses padrões. É como se fosse uma pessoa diz que diz "vc não precisa usar dourado pra brilhar, enquanto usa um vestido dourado que comprou com o dinheiro dos fãs em que ajuda na autoaceitação contra o dourado". Ela alimenta os padrões que critica. Amo o talento que tem como cantora, mas nessa questão eu acho hipocrisia. Assim como muitas cantoras. A Lizzo é um caso que serve de exemplo real fazendo juz ao que diz, através da própria vivência. Cada vez mais percebo a tentativa das celebridades de vender uma imagem em cima das nossas necessidades. Mas a gente desconhece quem eles são. É um pouco triste essa desilusão, e também é bom. Aquela imagem superestimada que tinha sido projeta no artista não existe, só é possível de alcançar com produções.
author: Ariel Garcia de Novaes
